questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a Factory Acceptance Test (FAT)?

answers.a: To verify the installation of equipment at the site
answers.b: To test the equipment at the manufacturer's site before shipment
answers.c: To train operators on the equipment
answers.d: To inspect the equipment for damage during transportation

questions.question: Which of the following documents is typically prepared by the vendor and submitted to the purchaser before the FAT?
What is the main objective of a Site Acceptance Test (SAT)?

answers.a: To verify the performance of the equipment at the site
answers.b: To inspect the equipment for damage during transportation
answers.c: To train operators on the equipment
answers.d: To test the equipment at the manufacturer's site before shipment

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical component of a SAT protocol?
What is the primary purpose of a Commissioning Acceptance Test (CAT)?

answers.a: To verify the performance of the equipment at the site
answers.b: To test the equipment at the manufacturer's site before shipment
answers.c: To commission the equipment and prepare it for operation
answers.d: To inspect the equipment for damage during transportation

questions.question: Who is typically responsible for preparing the CAT protocol?
What is the main difference between a FAT and a SAT?
Which of the following is a typical deliverable from a FAT?
What is the primary benefit of conducting a SAT?
Which of the following is a critical aspect of a CAT?
